items.title: The shortest and longest government shutdowns in U.S. history
items.description: The government shut down on Oct. 1. Here’s a look at the shortest and longest government shutdowns in U.S. history.

items.title: Democrats swept elections far beyond the big races in referendum on Trump
items.description: Beyond the big governors and New York mayor contests, Democrats on Tuesday flipped city councils, school boards and county commissions.

items.title: How Pelosi got her groove back: Fighting with Trump
items.description: The Democrat spent eight years in the wilderness of House minority, but her Trump clashes returned her to icon status.
